thread.title: Toddlers fall to their deaths in China mall when mother loses grip near balcony, AsiaOne Asia News
thread.title_full: Toddlers fall to their deaths in China mall when mother loses grip near balcony, AsiaOne Asia News

title: Toddlers fall to their deaths in China mall when mother loses grip near balcony, AsiaOne Asia News
text:
Toddlers fall to their deaths in China mall when mother loses grip near balcony AsiaOne | Tuesday, Feb 28, 2017 Photo: Weibo AsiaOne Tuesday, Feb 28, 2017 
Two toddlers, aged two and three, have died after plunging four storeys at a shopping mall in Tianjin, China on Monday night (Feb 27). 
Chinese media reported that their mother had been holding them near a glass balcony when she lost her grip on them. The children - a boy and a girl - fell to the ground on the first floor and died instantly, Sina reported. 
Video footage which purportedly shows the children's kin kneeling near their bodies and wailing in grief, has been shared on Chinese social media sites. Photo: Video screengrabs 
In a similar incident in Uzbekistan this month, a young mother accidentally dropped her baby off the side of the escalator when her dress got caught, and her body jerked forward as a result.
